sentence.Network_en: Today he is formally announcing his candidacy for President.
sentence.Network_cn: 今天他将正式宣布参加总统竞选。

sentence.Network_en: This morning the American was formally handed over to the ambassador.
sentence.Network_cn: 今天上午这名美国人被正式移交给了大使。

sentence.Network_en: Two years ago, Congress formally apologized for the internment.
sentence.Network_cn: 两年前，国会就此拘留事件正式道歉。

《Friends》词汇表B ... painless adj. 无痛的, 不痛的 formally adv. 正式地, 形式上 yugoslavian n. 南斯拉夫人, 南斯拉夫.
新概念英语第二册课堂笔记第64课_英语网 ... official （官方的） formally （一般） couple/pair 两个.
prove formally ; demonstrate by a mathematical , formal proof .从形式上证明；通过一个数学的或形式的证据来演示某事物。

list.abs: 高一英语单词表 - 豆丁网 ... South Carolina 南卡罗来纳州（美国州名） formal adj 正式的；正规的 error n 错误；差错.
西方正式（formal）着装高度制度化（highly codified）并有固定定义（fixed definition），但非正式（casual）着装则变化迅速，女装 …
形式主义（formalism），指在艺术、文学、与哲学上，对形式而非内容的着重。有形式主义行为的人，被称为“形式主义者”。
手字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 手心〖 thepalmofthehand〗 手续〖 procedures;formality〗 手眼〖 stunt〗.

entry.def: Formal speech or behaviour is very correct and serious rather than relaxed and friendly, and is used especially in official situations.

example.ex: He wrote a very formal letter of apology to Douglas...
example.tran: 他给道格拉斯写了一封非常正式的道歉信。

example.ex: Business relationships are necessarily a bit more formal.
example.tran: 商业关系有必要更正式一些。

entry.tran: (行为、声明或要求)官方的，正式的
entry.def: A formal action, statement, or request is an official one.

example.ex: UN officials said a formal request was passed to American authorities...
example.tran: 联合国官员称正式请求已向美国当局转达。

example.ex: No formal announcement had been made.

entry.def: Formal occasions are special occasions at which people wear smart clothes and behave according to a set of accepted rules.

example.ex: One evening the film company arranged a formal dinner after the play.
example.tran: 一天晚上，电影公司在演出结束后安排了一个正式的晚宴。

entry.tran: (服饰)正规的，正式的，适合正式场合的
entry.def: Formal clothes are very smart clothes that are suitable for formal occasions.

example.ex: They wore ordinary ties instead of the more formal high collar and cravat.
example.tran: 他们打着普通的领带，而不是更为正式的高领领结。

entry.tran: 整齐的;规矩的;井然有序的
entry.def: Something that is done, written, or studied in a formal way has a very ordered, organized method or style.

example.ex: This does not encourage the child to analyse the environment in a formal way...
example.tran: 这并不能鼓励孩子有条理地分析周围的环境。

example.ex: Classic Greek drama was written in verse, usually in an elevated and formal style.
example.tran: 古典希腊戏剧以韵文写成，通常用词讲究、结构整齐。

entry.def: Formal education or training is given officially, usually in a school, college, or university.

example.ex: Although his formal education stopped after primary school, he was an avid reader...
example.tran: 尽管小学毕业后就再没有受过正规的教育，他却十分爱读书。

example.ex: Leroy didn't have any formal dance training.
example.tran: 勒罗伊没受过任何正规的舞蹈训练。

entry.tran: (尤指按照某种设计规则)布局匀称的，布置整齐的
entry.def: A formal garden or room is arranged in a very regular and controlled way, especially according to certain rules of design.

example.ex: The Coronata wallpaper lends a formal air to the dining room.
example.tran: 科罗娜塔墙纸给餐厅增添了一种整齐有致的气氛。

auth_sentence.content: The government will formally respond to the committee later.
auth_sentence.res_content: The government will formally respond to the committee later.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The government will formally respond to the committee later.

auth_sentence.content: In addition, they have never been formally charged.
auth_sentence.res_content: In addition, they have never been formally charged.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In addition, they have never been formally charged.

auth_sentence.content: Formally separates from the Gilbert and Ellice Islands Colony.
auth_sentence.res_content: Formally separates from the Gilbert and Ellice Islands Colony.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Formally separates from the Gilbert and Ellice Islands Colony.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表形容词,表示"……的",通常在在名词后.; 2. 表副词,放在形容词后,"……地"

stems_affixes.word_buile: come来+ly……的→翩翩而来→美丽动人的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 昂贵的,价值高的,豪华的
stems_affixes.word_buile: cost代价+ly……的→adj.昂贵的,价值高的,豪华的
drizz毛毛雨+ly……的→adj.毛毛雨的[a drizzly day]
friend朋友+ly……的→adj.友好的,友谊的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 很可能的,合适的,可靠的
stems_affixes.word_buile: like像+ly……的→adj.很可能的,合适的,可靠的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 活泼的,活跃的;栩栩如生的,真实的
stems_affixes.word_buile: live活+ly……的→adj.活泼的,活跃的;栩栩如生的,真实的
man男人+ly……的→adj.男子气概的,果断的
niggard小气鬼+ly……的→adj.吝啬的,勉强的
otherworld超世+ly……的→adj.超脱尘世的,超俗的
spindle细长的人[或物]+ly……的→spindly细长的,纤弱的
time时间+ly……的→adj.及时的,适时的
week周+ly……的→adj.每星期的,一周的 adv.每周一次 n.周刊,周报
month月+ly……的→adj.每月的 adv.每月一次,按月 n.月刊
continuous连续的+ly……的→adv.不断地,连续地

stems_affixes.value_cn: 幸福地,愉快地,恰当地,幸亏
stems_affixes.word_buile: happy快乐的,幸福的+ly……的→happily幸福地
active积极的+ly……地→adv.活跃地,积极地
week周+ly……的→adj.每星期的,一周的 adv.每周一次 n.周刊,周报
month月+ly……的→adj.每月的 adv.每月一次,按月 n.月刊
according相符的+ly……地→adv.因此,从而
final最后的+ly……地→adv.最后,终于

stems_affixes.value_cn: 实际上,事实上,竟然,居然,如今
stems_affixes.word_buile: actual[adj.实际的, 真实的, 现行的, 目前的]+ly……地→adv.实际上,事实上,竟然,居然,如今
adequate足够的+ly……地→adv.充分地
consequent作为结果的+ly……地→adv.从而,因此
anxious担忧的+ly……地→adv.忧虑地,不安地
biological[adj.生物学的]+ly……地→adv.生物学上
certain肯定的+ly……地→adv.的确,[口语]当然,行
chief主要的+ly……地→adv.首要,主要地
commercial商业的+ly……地→adv.商业上,通商上

stems_affixes.value_cn: 普遍地,通常地,现在,当前
stems_affixes.word_buile: current当前的,流动的+ly……地→adv.普遍地,通常地,现在,当前
decided确定的+ly……地→adv.果断地,断然地
definite明确的+ly……地→adv.一定地,明确地
easy容易的+ly……地→easily容易地
economical节约的,经济的+ly……地→adv.经济地,经济学地
exact强求,精确的+ly……地→adv.正确地,严密地
exceeding非常的+ly……地→adv.极端地,非常
excessive过分的+ly……地→adv.过分地,非常地
extreme极端的+ly……地→adv.极端地,极其,非常
aggressive侵略的+ly……地→adv. 侵略地,攻势地
financial财政的,金融的+ly……地→adv.财政上,金融上
formal正式的;形式的+ly……地→adv.正式地,形式上
fortunate幸运的+ly……地→adv.幸运地
general总的,大体的+ly……地→adv.一般,通常,一般地
glorious光荣的,显赫的+ly……地→adv.光荣地,辉煌地
great大的+ly……地→adv.大大地,非常
immediate立即的+ly……地→adv.立即,马上,直接地
incidental附带的+ly……地→adv.附带地,顺便提及
increasing渐增的+ly……地→adv.日益,愈加
instant立即的;紧迫的+ly……地→adv.立即地,即刻地
like像+ly……地→有些像的→很可能
logical逻辑的,符合逻辑的+ly……地→adv.论理上,逻辑上
mental精神的+ly……地→adv.精神上,智力上,在内心
moderate中等的,适度的+ly……地→adv.适度地
natural自然的+ly……地→adv.自然地
necessary必要的+ly……地→necessarily必要地
polite有礼貌的+ly……地→adv.客气地,斯文地,优雅地
positive肯定的,积极的+ly……地→adv.断然地;肯定地
preferable更可取的+ly……地→preferably更适宜
present现在+ly……地→adv.目前,不久
probable可能的+ly……地→probably或许,大概
progressive前进的+ly……地→adv.日益增多地
prompt敏捷的+ly……地→adv.敏捷地,迅速地
relative相对的;相关的+ly……地→adv.相关地
repeated重复的+ly表副词→adv.重复地,再三地

stems_affixes.value_cn: 立刻,不久,简略地,简言之,即刻
stems_affixes.word_buile: short短+ly……地→adv.立刻,不久,简略地,简言之,即刻
sufficient足够的+ly……地→adv.十分地,充分地
undoubted无疑的,确实的+ly……地→adv.无庸置疑地,的确地
unfortunate不幸的+ly……地→adv.不幸地
uniform贯的,一致的+ly……地→adv.一律地,均一地
week周+ly……的→adj.每星期的,一周的 adv.每周一次 n.周刊,周报
month月+ly……的→adj.每月的 adv.每月一次,按月 n.月刊

Sentence.sentence: The speakers will dress formally for the concert.

sentences.en: His appointment has not been formally approved yet.
sentences.cn: 他的任命还未获正式批准。

sentences.en: China formally declared war against Japan in December 1941.
sentences.cn: 中国在1941年12月正式对日本宣战。

sentences.en: Less formally educated people can acquire professional competence.
sentences.cn: 接受比较非正规教育的人可以学习专业技能。

sentences.en: Everyone was formally lined up to meet the king.
sentences.cn: 大家拘谨地列好队迎接国王。
